main.name: Kyle Cheung
main.description: In the business of turning ideas into realities
main.bio: I am a Toronto based Full-Stack Developer with experience in a variety of technologies. My passion for building started at a young age when I was gifted my first Lego set. I'd spend hours in my bedroom putting blocks together to build robots and whatever else I could think of. Programming, similarly is about taking fundamental concepts and adding those blocks together. Everything starts with the basics, which is why I enjoy experimenting with as many things as possible and expanding my breadth of knowledge. Currently, I specialize in developing using a JavaScript stack. I strongly believe that Progressive-Web-Apps are the future. As people move away from laptops and desktop computers, smartphones become more essential in everyday life. I aim to deliver a valuable and consistent product across devices at the touch of a finger. My interests include Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. Data excites me, and the many possible applications in the future keep me eager to learn.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Data Structures & Algorithms, Operating Systems, Linear Algebra, Databases, Computer Networks, Software Design & Analysis, Artificial Intelligence, Software Tools, & Systems Programming, Human-Computer Interaction

work.title: Contract Web Developer
work.description: Contracted to develop a Generational Accounting Calculator using React. I was in charge of building the app from the ground up and styling it using CSS and Javascript. I ensured browser compatibility with Internet Explorer as well as helped the employer set set up custom domains and launch the application.

work.title: I.T. Technician
work.description: I was responsible for conversing with clients and troubleshooting technical problems as smoothly as possible. I learned how to explain complex concepts as simply as possible as well as learning how to use administrative software to remotely help clients as well.
